page.title: 07CHURCH HISTORY.
page.content: were so disgusted and worried by these ruins that many volunteered not only to make the ruins safe but to tidy up the whole area,including the church-yard.Today St.Michael's Church is a popular place for many visitors to Abberley,not just because of its long historical link,but for its whole picturesque setting in the heart of the old village. {ST.MARY'S CHURCH.} The strong gales in 1849 caused so much damage to the old spire of St.Michael's church that a new site was chosen and a new church built. The site was given by Mr.Moilliet.The foundation stone was laid in 1850.In 1852 it was consecrated by the Bishop of Hereford.The church was built in the Early English style.In 1873 a fire caused extensive damage -the whole church was completely gutted.
